statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Central Connecticut St. 71, Mount St. Mary's, Md. 63
article.headline: Central Connecticut St. 71, Mount St. Mary's, Md. 63
article.linkText: Central Connecticut St. 71, Mount St. Mary's, Md. 63
article.story: EMMITSBURG, Md. (AP) -- Obie Nwadike had 18 points and 10 rebounds for Central Connecticut State, who defeated Mount St. Mary's 71-63 on Saturday. Tristan Blackwood also had 18 points for the Blue Devils (6-10, 3-1 Northeast Conference). Javier Mojica contributed 15 points and Jemino Sobers scored 13 points. Jeremy Goode led the Mount (5-12, 4-2 NEC) with 20 points. He had help from Mychal Kearse, who finished with 13 points. Chris Vann added 10 points to score in double figures in his 16th consecutive game. The Mount led early in the second half, but Blackwood's 3-pointer with 15:26 remaining broke a 37-37 tie. A Mount St. Mary's 5-0 run, including a Kearse 3-pointer with 6:38 to go, brought them within four points. But Blackwood nailed a 3-pointer of his own on the next play, and the Blue Devils were never behind after that.
